text: Philip "Fyvush" Finkel (October 9, 1922 - August 14, 2016) was an American actor, singer and comedian. He is best known for his role as lawyer Douglas Wambaugh on the television series Picket Fences and as Harvey Lipschultz, a crotchety U.S. history teacher, on the television series Boston Public. He earned an Emmy Award for the first role in 1994. Finkel was born in Brownsville, Brooklyn of New York City, New York. He was married to playwright Gertrude Lieberman from 1947 until her death in 2008. They had two sons together, Ian and Elliot. Finkel died of a heart attack in Manhattan, New York on August 14, 2016, aged 93. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1922 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Actors from New York City Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:Comedians from New York City Category:Jewish American actors Category:Jewish American musicians Category:Singers from New York City Category:Emmy Award winning actors
title: Fyvush Finkel
